title: Meloni tightens security policy as political tensions grip Italy
subhead: The heavy atmosphere since the summer of 2025 has been exacerbated by footage of a police officer being violently assaulted by protesters in Turin at the end of January.

title: Emmanuel Macron: 'Now is the time for the EU to launch a joint borrowing capacity, through eurobonds'
How the Epstein scandal brought down Jack Lang
'The US crisis around ICE evokes the one sparked by the Fugitive Slave Act of 1850'
subhead: Professor emerita Marie-Jeanne Rossignol draws a parallel between anti-ICE activists, who whistle to alert immigrant communities of the arrival of agents, and the abolitionists who once posted signs identifying slave catchers.

title: Moscow restricts Telegram as it pushes rival state-backed messaging app
subhead: From February 9, Russian users of the messaging and call app Telegram began reporting access issues. Russian authorities have denounced Telegram's alleged lack of action against its use for 'criminal and terrorist purposes.'

title: New York's 'bodega boys,' the Yemeni shopkeepers caught in Trump's immigration crackdown
subhead: The Trump administration imposed a new entry ban in June 2025 targeting 12 countries, including Yemen. The move has put at risk a community deeply rooted in the local economy: the 'bodega boys,' mostly Yemeni shopkeepers who run corner grocery stores throughout New York.

title: The international drug trafficker who operated right next to the Elys√©e Palace
subhead: Firat Cinko faces life imprisonment for allegedly orchestrating international cocaine trafficking between Venezuela, Martinique and France aboard a Smart car parked near the presidential palace in Paris.

Iran: Videos show live ammunition used in crackdown
subhead: The protests that shook the country from late December to mid-January were met with unprecedented violence. Despite an internet blackout, footage verified by Le Monde shows security forces using military-grade weapons against demonstrators, while authorities now openly acknowledge the armed intervention of security forces.

title: How Donald Trump is rewriting US history
subhead: As the country marks its 250th anniversary this year, the American president, who returned to the White House on January 20, 2025, has worked to shape a revised historical narrative, revealing signs of megalomania.

title: Mayor and mother: The young women changing France's local councils
subhead: Only 41 women under the age of 30 were elected as mayors in 2020, out of France's 34,885 mayors. Here are the stories of several women who have balanced their careers, motherhood and first terms in office in a political scene often dominated by older men.
